title: How to Play Kop

steps.headline: Learn the objective.
steps.description: The objective of Kop is to have a majority of the points (53 or more).

steps.headline: Set up the deck.
steps.description: Only 16 cards are ever used in this game: the aces, queens, jacks and 10s.

steps.headline: Set the teams.
steps.description: Usually, in a game of Kop, there are 4 players. The teams are the players who hold the both the black queens (the stare) (Queen of spades and Queen of clubs) versus the players who don't.

steps.headline: Learn about the trumps.
steps.description: All queens and jacks are trumps (trumfy). The highest trumps are the Ace and 10 of hearts, and the Ace and 10 of Diamonds. There are 12 trumps in all, leaving only 4 that aren't (obce). The trumps include all hearts and diamonds, and the Jack and Queen of Spades and Clubs. The two lowest trumps, the Ace and 10 of Diamonds, are called ryzyka.

steps.headline: Pick a dealer.
steps.description: He will shuffle the 16 cards and deal 4 cards to each player. For the next round, the player to the dealer's left will become the new dealer.

steps.headline: Make your announcements.
steps.description:
Before the play, players will start bidding. Go around in a clockwise order, starting with the player to the left of the dealer. If that player has a bid, he says "May I?" and makes one of the three announcements shown below. Otherwise, start the play. Kontra doubles the value of the game. To double the value further, other players may say rej (4x) on subsequent turns, followed by bok (8x) and then słup (16x) During the bidding, the partnerships are usually unknown. Therefore, if two people double consecutively, they can become partners, however, two doubles by the same team will only count as one double. For example, if all four players (re)double, once the players team up, the multiplier is only 4x, and not 16x. Wesele is announced when a player hold both black queens and is looking for a partner. They will be partnered by whoever hold the highest Jack (excluding themselves). They can also stay silent (cicha) or announce zolo (du) (see below)

Zolo (Du) is announced when someone has both black queens. That player will play against the other three players. If Zolo Du is said, that player must win all four tricks.

steps.headline: Wrap up the bidding.
steps.description: It ends when three players in a row pass (say nothing).

steps.headline: Start the play.
steps.description: Once bidding is over, the player left of the dealer leads to the first trick.

steps.headline: Try to win tricks.
steps.description: Tricks are won by the highest trump in the trick, or the highest card overall.

steps.headline: Play cards.
steps.description: If a non-trump starts the play and the next player has the other non-trump card of that suit (e.g. Player 1 draws 10 of Spades, next player has Ace of Spades, so they must play it), then they must play that card. Otherwise, they must play a trump card and only trump cards higher than the highest trump of the current trick. If they can't, they can play any other trump card. If they have no trump cards, they can play any card.

steps.headline: Add up the final scores.
steps.description: There are a total of 104 points in the game. At the end of the play, each team counts the value of each of the cards they have won. Settling ties. If two teams each have 52 points, whoever announced the last double will lose. If no-one doubled, whoever hold the black queens loses. Playing solo. If the player playing alone wins, they must pay them 4x the amount for chica, 5x for zolo and 10x for zolo du. If they lose, they must pay the same amount of points to every player. Doubles. Every double announcement will double the payout of the game (see Bidding)

steps.headline: Find the winner.
steps.description: When one team has more than 52 points, they win the game!

Set the teams. Usually, in a game of Kop, there are 4 players. The trumps include all hearts and diamonds, and the Jack and Queen of Spades and Clubs. The two lowest trumps, the Ace and 10 of Diamonds, are called ryzyka. Bidding Pick a dealer. He will shuffle the 16 cards and deal 4 cards to each player. For the next round, the player to the dealer's left will become the new dealer. Make your announcements. Before the play, players will start bidding. Go around in a clockwise order, starting with the player to the left of the dealer. If that player has a bid, he says "May I?" and makes one of the three announcements shown below. Otherwise, start the play. Kontra doubles the value of the game. To double the value further, other players may say rej (4x) on subsequent turns, followed by bok (8x) and then słup (16x) During the bidding, the partnerships are usually unknown. Therefore, if two people double consecutively, they can become partners, however, two doubles by the same team will only count as one double. For example, if all four players (re)double, once the players team up, the multiplier is only 4x, and not 16x. Wesele is announced when a player hold both black queens and is looking for a partner. It ends when three players in a row pass (say nothing). Playing Kop Start the play. Once bidding is over, the player left of the dealer leads to the first trick. Try to win tricks. Tricks are won by the highest trump in the trick, or the highest card overall. Play cards. If a non-trump starts the play and the next player has the other non-trump card of that suit (e.g. Player 1 draws 10 of Spades, next player has Ace of Spades, so they must play it), then they must play that card. At the end of the play, each team counts the value of each of the cards they have won. Settling ties. If two teams each have 52 points, whoever announced the last double will lose. If no-one doubled, whoever hold the black queens loses. Playing solo. If the player playing alone wins, they must pay them 4x the amount for chica, 5x for zolo and 10x for zolo du. If they lose, they must pay the same amount of points to every player. Doubles. Every double announcement will double the payout of the game (see Bidding) Find the winner. When one team has more than 52 points, they win the game!
